definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: The welcome ceremony appears extremely busy, has the orchestra to play music, the firecrackers fireworks sound together.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎仪式显得热闹非凡，有乐队奏乐，鞭炮礼花齐鸣。

sentences.english: Free libations , holiday revelers, and of course, fireworks abound.
sentences.chinese: 免费的酒水，节日狂欢者，当然还有礼花燃放。

sentences.english: The fireworks that make all the brilliant, colorful designs in the sky are called aerial shells.
sentences.chinese: 在空中能制造出绚烂多姿的图案的烟火叫空中礼花弹。

sentences.english: After supper, Uncle took us downstairs to set off fireworks.
sentences.chinese: 吃过晚饭，舅舅带我们下楼放礼花。

sentences.english: "Smiley face" style fireworks and other picture depicted the opening of China.
sentences.chinese: “笑脸”等造型礼花描绘出开放中国的图景。

sentences.english: Provide cold light fireworks, hand-hold fireworks, firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 提供冷光焰火，手持烟花，组合礼花弹。

sentences.english: Just one year of love, is better than a lifetime alone;
sentences.chinese: 每一首都像是礼花弹，点燃人内心深处的激情。

sentences.english: She said she was inspired when she saw early morning fireworks kicking off the marathon the year before.
sentences.chinese: 她说前年看到启动马拉松比赛的清晨礼花大受鼓舞。

definition: sky lantern (miniature hot-air balloon used during festivals)
